TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed MsgBoxResult extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Indicates which button was pressed on a message box, returned by the function.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you call the `MsgBox` function, you can use the `MsgBoxResult` enumeration in your code in place of the actual values.
The `MsgBox` function returns a `MsgBoxResult` enumeration value.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.MsgBoxResult Abort = int32(3)

Docs.summary: **Abort** button was pressed. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.MsgBoxResult Cancel = int32(2)

Docs.summary: **Cancel** button was pressed. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.MsgBoxResult Ignore = int32(5)

Docs.summary: **Ignore** button was pressed. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.MsgBoxResult No = int32(7)

Docs.summary: **No** button was pressed. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.MsgBoxResult Ok = int32(1)

Docs.summary: **OK** button was pressed. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.MsgBoxResult Retry = int32(4)

Docs.summary: **Retry** button was pressed. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.MsgBoxResult Yes = int32(6)

Docs.summary: **Yes** button was pressed. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant .
